function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Debate over the importance of absolute humidity (AH) versus relative humidity (RH) for influenza virus survival","Impact":"Inaccurate understanding of the environmental factors affecting influenza virus survival and transmission","Mitigation":"Conduct further studies to clarify the role of absolute and relative humidity in influenza virus survival and transmission","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring technologies, virus stability testing","People":"Researchers, healthcare professionals","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Incomplete understanding of the factors influencing influenza virus stability and transmission","Impact":"Inability to effectively control and mitigate influenza transmission in the built environment","Mitigation":"Continue research to elucidate the role of temperature, relative humidity, and absolute humidity in virus stability","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring technologies, virus stability testing","People":"Researchers, public health professionals","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Lack of clarity on the influence of relative humidity on influenza virus survival and seasonality","Impact":"Unpredictable influenza incidence and seasonality, leading to potential outbreaks","Mitigation":"Conduct studies to determine the relationship between relative humidity and influenza incidence and seasonality","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring technologies, epidemiological surveillance","People":"Epidemiologists, researchers, public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"}]}
